intro: Oxypetalum suboppositum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, giving it the specific epithet "suboppositum." Oxypetalum suboppositum is often found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
